content:
I am a Ph.D. candidate in the Department of Sociology with a minor in Statistics. I study social dynamics of differentiation and integration in groups using different statistical and computational tools, including online experiments, panel data, machine learning, and natural language processing. My research centers on reward systems, social norms, and cultural integration, with an emphasis on the individual mechanisms that contribute to the existence of complex social structures.
Before starting my doctoral studies at Cornell University, I received a B.A. in Education (2008) and a B.A. in Philosophy (2009) from Universidad de los Andes (Chile) and a M.A. in Sociology (2012) from Universidad Catolica de Chile.

title: Curriculum Vitae

content:
Published Work  Molina, Mario D., Mauricio Bucca, & Michael W. Macy (2019), “It is not just how the game is played, it is whether you win or lose”. Science Advances, vol. 5, eaau1156. [article], [replication package].
Science Advances Interview: You can see the video interview here.
Press Coverage: The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Guardian, U.S. News, ABC News, The Japan Times, The Telegraph, New Scientist, ZME Science, among others. You can read the coverage by The Associated Press, ZME Science, The New Scientist, and the Cornell Chronicle.
 Molina, Mario & Filiz Garip (2019), “Machine learning for sociology”, Annual Review of Sociology, vol. 45. [article], [preprint].
  Work in Progress  Molina, Mario D., “Resting on your laurels? Status dynamics and individual effort in a large online community”.
 Molina, Mario D., Hakan Holm, & Victor Nee, “Cooperation with strangers: Spillover of community norms”. (Under review)
 Garip, Filiz & Mario D. Molina, “Predictive machine learning models for exploring environment and migration linkages in historical Mexico-US. flows”.
 Drouhot, Lucas, Mario D. Molina, & Filiz Garip, “Identity and relational structure among immigrant adolescents in Western Europe”.
 Asad, Asad, Neil Jr. Lewis, & Mario D. Molina, “Profiles of psychological distress among noncitizens in the United States, 2011-2018”.
 Molina, Mario D. & Filiz Garip, “Network amplification”.
